Jersey City
===========

Frank E. Gilmore, Ward F
------------------------

Frank E. Gilmore, Ward F

* [City Council](https://www.jerseycitynj.gov/cityhall/CityCouncil/)

| ![Frank Gilmore photo](https://cdnsm5-hosted.civiclive.com/UserFiles/Servers/Server_6189660/Image/City%20Hall/City%20Council/Frank%20Gilmore/gilmore.jpeg "Frank Gilmore photo") | WARD F COUNCILMAN FRANK E GILMORE    Term of Office:   First elected to council: November 2, 2021   Current term expires: January 14, 2030     FEGilmore@jcnj.org   201-547-5338     Aides :   Erica Walker - Constituent Services & Executive Administration   [EWalker@jcnj.org](mailto:EWalker@jcnj.org)   201-273-0245     Laneisha Trent - Community Calendar & Digital Media   [ltrent@jcnj.org](mailto:ltrent@jcnj.org?subject=ltrent@jcnj.org)     Gina Davison - Legislative Research   [GDavison@jcnj.org](mailto:GDavison@jcnj.org?subject=Gina%20email)     Tina Nalls - Community Engagement   [TNalls@jcnj.org](mailto:TNalls@jcnj.org?subject=Tina%20email)     Ward F website: [www.everythingwardf.com](http://www.everythingwardf.com/ "Ward F Website") |

Councilman Frank E. Gilmore proudly represents Ward F on the Jersey City Municipal Council, where he continues to serve with a deep commitment to equity, education, public safety, and community empowerment. Having earned the trust of residents through re-election, Councilman Gilmore remains focused on delivering responsive, people-centered government that meets residents where they are. A lifelong Jersey City resident and proud graduate of the city’s public schools, Councilman Gilmore’s leadership is shaped by lived experience and a clear understanding of the challenges and opportunities facing working families. He is widely recognized for his hands-on approach to constituent services, ensuring residents receive timely support and clear communication when navigating city agencies. Throughout his tenure, Councilman Gilmore has consistently championed investments in neighborhoods that have historically been overlooked. Councilman Gilmore is also committed to preserving Ward F’s cultural identity while supporting responsible development that benefits longtime residents as well as transients. He supports affordable housing strategies, local hiring, and policies that promote fairness and opportunity for small businesses, seniors, and families. Above all, Councilman Gilmore believes that effective leadership starts with listening. His re-election reflects a continued partnership with the residents of Ward F—one rooted in trust, accountability, and a shared vision for a safer, stronger, and more inclusive Jersey City.

![Jersey City](https://cdnsm5-hosted.civiclive.com/UserFiles/Servers/Server_6189660/Image/logo/white-logo.png)

Jersey City, New Jersey

Jersey City NJ 07302

201-547-5000
